climbs.name: Splash it on and be Selfless

content.description:
Start directly below the obvious black water groove on a right facing hueco. Navigate through the short roof and continue upwards towards the airy summit. Stay attentive on the somewhat solid, lichen-covered holds as you near the top - a fall from up high would be disastrous. 

  Note - At opportune times throughout the year the Wellsite is filled with water, completely covering the fallzone in ankle-deep ponding water. For the bold, this marks the moment to either send or splash.
content.protection: More of a solo. If you need pads for this, you probably shouldn't be on it.
content.location: Center of the southeast-facing wall, just past and opposite the big oak tree once the corridor opens up.

content.description: This problem starts on good holds to the right of Eckagrata. Climb up and slightly left on fun moves. The boulder to the right of the top is off making the top out quite challenging.
The stand start to The Bathtub from the rest jug right after the tub. Just something for the less strong to climb, but also a worthy climb in itself.Â

Excellent quality highball about 20' to the right of Splash it On And Be Selfless.  Start standing on the skirt with small crimps (directly across from the base of the tree). Do a couple of moves on crimper plates then up the right side of the giant Hueco.  There's a good rest in the second Hueco at about 20'. Easier climbing on good incut crimps all the way to the top.
Underrated roof climb inside the cave at the well site. Start on slopey huecos and climb through jugs, pinches, and slopers to the face. Then move up the face.
content.location: Inside the cave at the well site, behind the large Boulder. Guide required.

content.description: Eckagrata is essentially two moves of V6 do a hard dyno to a V2/4 top out depending on if you choose to go straight up at the top out or traverse to the left on jugs.  The PG-13 rating is for the latter top out as you climb over a boulder that would hurt to land on.  This problem is also known as the Wellsite Dyno.
content.protection: 2 pads.  Spotter for the top out.
content.location: This route begins on two small pockets and a high right foot.

content.description: Start matched in good juggy huecos.  Make a long reach to the left for a crimp. Match and continue left until you can go up and top out through jugs.
content.location: Next line to the right of the Bathtub

content.description: Start on the first couple moves of the Bathtub, then exit straight up.

A really good long and varied rising traverse. The landing follows the problem for much of it's length and you are not far off the ground until the very end which is a bit easier. 

  Start low and left from a sit and boulder up on some smaller crimpy holds, there is one that is pretty bad. Eventually you move up and right into slopers along the bottom of the "bathtub" feature. Work across the slopers to the other end of the "bathtub". Move up into the right end of the "bathtub" and out on underclings and pinches to a big move up to a jug. At this point you are starting to get up off the ground a bit. Move up the face with long moves between pretty good holds.
content.location: You will walk past this problem on your way up the slabs to the Wellsite.

content.description: This is a water cut cavern that holds the evening cold late into the day.  However, it is easy to walk out of the cavern to get into the sun.  At times a small stream runs through the entire cavern.  One of the most unique and beautiful areas in Hueco and you're virtually guaranteed to never see anyone else down there.
